Title: N/A

reviewText: If you're looking for a creepy horror flick about a woman who is terrorized by a killer in her house, like the title and the cover art of this DVD suggest, look elsewhere.  This made-for-TV thriller, filmed for the "Lifetime" channel and Canadian cable-TV, is a hybrid of the murder/suspense and "woman-in-jeopardy" genres, and a pretty standard one at that.  It's about a woman (Tracy Nelson) whose troubled teenage son is charged with a murder he didn't commit -- he apparently killed the married woman who was having an affair with him -- and since it appears to be such an open-and-shut case, with all evidence pointing squarely at her son, she must investigate the case herself and find the real killer at great risk of her own life.This is the sort of movie that you might find yourself watching if it comes on the TV and you don't feel like mustering the energy to lift the remote control.  It's good enough to hold your interest if you're in the right mood, but nothing worth seeking out or adding to your DVD collection.  The actual killer is revealed about halfway through the movie, but if you don't figure out who is really behind the murder the instant this character walks onscreen, well...
summary: An okay flick if you catch it on TV, but...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Tracy Nelson doesn't get enough credit for her acting abilities, but once again she makes her character so believable! Every mother can understand that this woman will do almost anything to prove her sons innocence. First she must get to the truth, since the police don't seem to be able to do that. But sometimes the truth hurts, is this one of those times?

reviewText: This was more or less a lifetime movie network type of movie but I always enjoy Tracy Nelson and it was interesting with several plot twists.
summary: Enjoyable if you like the Lifetime Movie Network

reviewText: When a former high profile model and the wife of a wealthy businesswoman is murdered, all evidence points to high school senior Michael Nowlin (Christopher Jacot).Michael's overprotective mother (Tracy Nelson) decides to prove her son's innocence, but she begins to uncover evidence that connects him to the crime. Against all odds, Sandra will risk everything to clear his name.
